title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 185.5 - Destruction
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 185.5 - Destruction

State Regulations
(a) Except as
provided in section
185.4
(d) of this

Part, for Mint stamps and Conservation Edition prints, all unsold Mint stamps
and prints in the possession of the department, and in the possession of its
contractor or contractors for the production of such Mint stamps and prints, shall be destroyed at the end of the third year following the issue
year. (b) Following the destruction
of stamps and prints pursuant to subdivision (a) of this section, no additional
products bearing the design of the destroyed Mint stamps will be produced
except promotional materials used to promote the whole program, as provided in
section
185.4
(f) of this

Part. (c) All unsold migratory bird
products, other than Mint stamps and prints, in the possession of the
department at the end of the third year following the issue year may be
disposed of at the department's discretion. Priority will be given to provide
such products, without cost, to not-for-profit and charitable organizations for
program promotional purposes, or to educational institutions and facilities for
promoting awareness of migratory bird conservation and management. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
ยง
185.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
